data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 2 believers in Jegunovtse to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Jegunovtse, North Macedonia
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Lord, please give apostles to expand the church into every neighborhood of Jegunovtse, North Macedonia.
data.verse: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Jegunovtse access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Jegunovtse, North Macedonia and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

data.prayer: Lord, I thank you that you will bring health and a cure to the Albanian, Macedonian people. Reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.
Lord, let it be said of the 898 lost in Jegunovtse that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Father, let every disciple be a disciple maker, every home a training center, and every church a church planting movement in the state of Jegunovtse, North Macedonia.
Spirit, give faith and responsive hearts to the 900 citizens of the the state of Jegunovtse.
data.verse: Seek the Lord while he may be found; call upon him while he is near.
